column2: Lords and Heroes all have abilities to aid them in their quest for supremacy on campaign and in battle.
Unique and bizarre abilities that can only be found at the mysterious locations where quest battles are fought.
Items with magical properties may assist their owners on the battlefield.
An ability is as much a part of its owning units as arms or legs, and can mark the difference between victory and defeat.
A varied and powerful ability type, often concerned with defence.
Weapons can do so much more than hack and slash - some are imbued with magical properties to further aid their bearers.
These abilities are not bound to any one unit and can therefore be used anywhere on the battlefield.
When the Ruinous Powers smile upon their servants, those marks - and their beneficial effects - are borne for the duration of the battle.
A Hero's abilities are specific to their owner, providing temporary or permanent assistance.
A Lord's abilities are specific to their owner, providing temporary or permanent assistance.
The foundation of any spell connected to a magical Lore, attributes offer wide-reaching and constant effects.
Banners can be carried into battle by any unit, improving their condition for the duration of the fray.
Spells sometimes apply limited charges to items or weapons, without draining the Winds of Magic.
A mount's abilities are a core part of its being and, used wisely, can mark the difference between victory and defeat.
Spells are summoned from the Winds of Magic, taking time and energy to conjure, and always directed outwards - never on the magic-user themself.
These abilities are intrinsic to the faction and its specific personality.
